src:
Klasemen Liga 1 dan Top Skor Usai Persib Tekuk Kalteng Putra 2-0
01 Nov 2019, 13:39 by Tempo.co, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Persib Bandung mampu menjaga kebangkitannya di Liga 1 2019. Mereka menang 2-0 saat berlaga di kandang Kalteng Putra, Stadion Tuah Pahoe, dalam laga pekan ke-26, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Gol Persib dicetak Kevin va Kippersluis (menit 45) dan Ezechiel N'Douassel (61). Kalteng Putra kesulitan membalas terlebih karena mereka sudah harus bermain 10 orang sejak menit -29 karena Patrich Wanggai mendapat kartu merah.
Ini menjadi kemenangan kedua yang diraih Persib secara beruntun. Posisi dalam di klasemen Liga 1 pun naik. Tim berjuluk Maung Bandung berada di peringkat 8 dengan 34 poin. Sementara Kalteng Putra menempati posisi ke-17 mengemas 23 poin.
Pada laga lainnya, yang berlangsung sore hari, Arema FC takluk 3-4 saat berlaga di kandang Perseru Badak Lampung FC, Stadion Sumpah Pemuda.
Marquinhos mencetak hat-trick buat Badak Lampung, pada menit 9, 75, dan 85. Satu gol tuan rumah lain diciptakan Panto Hariyanto (17). Gol Arema dilesakkan Sunarto (50), Makan Konate (78/penalti), dan Hamka Hamzah (82).
Hasil ini menambah panjang catatan buruk Arema di putaran kedua. Mereka hanya bisa menang sekali dalam lima laga terakhirnya. Hasil ini juga memperpanjang rekor buruk Singo Edan dalam laga tandang. Mereka hanya bisa menang tiga kali dalam 12 laga dan sekali meraih hasil seri.
Kekalahan ini pun membuat Arema tetap di urutan keenam dengan 38 poin dari 24 laga. Asa mereka untuk menjadi runner-up cukup berat untuk tercapai. Mereka kini tertinggal 17 poin dari Bali United di puncak klasemen dan terpaut 6 poin dari Madura United di urutan kedua.
Bagi Badak Lampung, kemenangan ini menjauhkan mereka dari zona degradasi. Mereka kini ada di urutan ke-13 klasemen Liga 1 sementara dengan 26 poin dari 26 laga, unggul dua poin dari Persela yang ada di zona degradasi.
Hasil dan jadwal Liga 1 JumatBadak Lampung 4-3 Arema FCKalteng Putra 0-2 Persib Bandung.

text:
League 1 Standings and Top Scores After Persib Bend Kalteng Men 2-0
Nov 01 2019, 13:39 by Tempo.co, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Persib Bandung was able to maintain its revival in League 1 2019. They won 2-0 when they competed in the Kalteng Putra cage, Tuah Pahoe Stadium, in the match week 26, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Persib scored by Kevin va Kippersluis (45 minutes) and Ezechiel N'Douassel (61). Kalteng Putra has difficulty replying first because they have had to play 10 people since the 29th minute because Patrich Wanggai gets a red card.
This is the second victory achieved by Persib in a row. Position in the League 1 standings went up. The team nicknamed Maung Bandung is ranked 8th with 34 points. While Kalteng Putra occupies the 17th position to pack 23 points.
In another match, which took place in the afternoon, Arema FC lost 3-4 when competing in the cage of Perseru Badak Lampung FC, Youth Oath Stadium.
Marquinhos scored a hat-trick for the Lampung Rhinos, in minutes 9, 75, and 85. Another goal from another host was created by Panto Hariyanto (17). Arema scored scored by Sunarto (50), Makan Konate (78 / penalty), and Hamka Hamzah (82).
These results add to the length of Arema's poor record in the second round. They can only win once in their last five matches. These results also extend Singo Edan's bad record in away games. They can only win three times in 12 matches and once won a draw.
This defeat also makes Arema remain sixth with 38 points from 24 matches. Their desire to become runner-up is hard enough to achieve. They are now 17 points behind Bali United at the top of the standings and 6 points adrift of Madura United in second.
For Lampung Rhinos, this victory kept them away from the relegation zone. They are now 13th in the League 1 standings with 26 points from 26 matches, two points ahead of Persela in the relegation zone.
League 1 results and fixtures FridayBadak Lampung 4-3 Arema FCKalteng Putra 0-2 Persib Bandung.
League Top Score 116 goals: Alex Goncalves (Persela) 15 goals: Marko Simic (Persija) 14 goals: Eating Konate (Arema) 13 goals: Beto Goncalvez (Madura United) m E Bokhasvili (PSS Sleman), Ilija Spasojevic (Bali United) 12 goals: Ciro (Tira Persikabo), Rafael Silva (Barito).
